content.description: Sit start on low, left hand jug and high, right hand undercling. Cool moves on cool holds lead to cruxy moves out to right facing sidepull rail. Match and step out right to the broken jug. Do the "blind swordsman" move over the lip to ok holds and summon the courage to move onward to the massive jug just out of sight. The mantle is airy but easy. Hyper classic!
content.location: To the left of Grand Master.

content.description: Stand start on left side of slopey arete and climb the slab up and left on small pockets, monos, edges, and slopers. This thing is pretty fun and always in the shade.
content.location: Left of Drunken Master.

content.description: Sit start crimps to angled jug. Move left to crimps and bad feet to thin bullet flake.
content.location: Left of Bruce Lefroy. This is farthest left line on the south side of the boulder.

content.description: One of the most unique boulder problems in Joe's Valley. Climb the basketball and melon sized cobbles for 20ft. It may only be V-Easy but it will be the coolest boulder problem you climb all day!
content.location: Around the corner from Hand of Doom, (see Death Scream area), and up the hill for a few minutes. Once you are above H.O.D., you will see a handful of boulders in a small gully off to the right. This is where Nugget Man lives.

content.description: Amazing dark slab with two diagonal gashes. Very good rock.
content.location: Half way up the hill just before the small cliff scramble. The trail goes right to it.

content.description: Start sitting and climb crimps to a pocket hold complex. Make hard moves to gain the sloping lip and find a way to get to the good crimp. Techy mantle. Amazing rock!!
content.location: Slightly up canyon from the K.F.T. boulder. From the K.F.T. boulder walk up canyon through a little notch. This boulder is hiding very close to the K.F.T. boulder.

content.description: Sit start on jug. Hard and long move to a gash. Do an awesome cross-over match move to good holds. Climbs into the same top out as Master Po or you can go left and top out Kung Fu Theatre at the same grade.
content.location: Left of Master Po.

content.description: Sit start. Climb up the 3 jug pockets and bust out left to another jug pocket on the lip. Mantle is the crux.
content.location: This is the right most line on the main face of the K.F.T. boulder.

content.description: Start on underclings. Cross right hand to a crimp. Climb two finger pockets and crimps to the small pocket crimp on the lip. Bust to the shallow, slopey, hold complex and float on to the jug. Amazing!!
content.location: Left of Zatoichi.

content.description: Sit start on jug. Climb the crimp latter to the jug hueco on the lip. Do battle with the hard and slopey mantle. Don't be afraid to scream like Bruce Lee as you fight your way to the top.
content.location: Left of Master Splinter.

content.description: Short and crimpy
content.location: Farthest right on the south side of the K.F.T. boulder.

content.description: Sit start with left hand undercling and right hand crimp. Do hard crimp moves to the broken jug high on the face. Gain the sloping lip and do a highball mantle. Easy slab to the top.
content.location: Left of 5 Deadly Venoms.

content.description: Fun moves on good holds lead to a crimp crux pulling into a committing mantle. Named after the frontman for The Butthole Surfers.
content.location: From the K.F.T. boulder walk up canyon passing Ninja Please for about 5 minutes. It is a very striking boulder and easy to spot.

content.description: Squat start on good holds in a little pit made by an old tree. Climb good crimps and big slopey huecos.
content.location: This boulder is directly across from the K.F.T. boulder.

content.description: This boulder is two boulders downhill from the Dungeon boulder. Start low in a cave. Hard moves on three mono-stacks gets you to the jug at the lip of the cave. Easy top out.
content.location: Two boulders downhill from the Dungeon boulder.

content.description: Start sitting down and far left of the little cave. Climb to the right, along the lip of the little cave. Hard moves and a dynamic move gets you to the jug above the cave. Techy mantle but not too hard.
content.location: Starts on the left side of the little cave very close to another little boulder.

content.description: The rock on this looks bad but it is quite excellent. Sit start on crimps. Move to jug crimp and then left hand to bad slimper with a thumb catch. Bust to massive jug. Climb hard left around the slopey arete and join up with Sumo slab.
content.location: Left of Kung Fury.

content.description: Start sitting in the little cave to the right of Dungeon Master. The rock is ugly but it proves to climb very well on little crimpers. The crux is getting to the jug pocket in the roof. Join Dungeon Master for the top out.
content.location: Right of Dungeon Master.

content.description: Short and crimpy.
content.location: Left of Grasshopper.

content.description: Sit start on tree stump with good crimps. Climb up sharp jugs and cool pockets to the high, slopey, crux mantle.
content.location: Left of Kung Fu Theatre.
